top_comment.text:
Alright, I'll admit it now. I have no concept of God. I readily replace his 
name with hope or magik (that's the real kind, not magical allusions). I 
haven't read the bible, but I've brushed up on some stories, and have been 
preached to. I just can't get behind it. When I hear a great message like 
this in a video, I internalize. "Tough it out," has been a motto for a long 
time. How does the whole Christian community know that there is such a 
thing as Christ? I feel like the higher being will all talk and think about 
is something people made up. Maybe I'm confused or the "enemy," beckons me 
to believe that there isn't a God. I have an idea of why we are here, but 
most people would think I'm crazy if I said anything about what makes sense 
to me. Who knows how many people I already lost because I said magik..
I'm searching for answers and anyone who would grace me with a reply would 
be appreciated.
Oh and for what it is worth I enjoy your videos.﻿
top_comment.author: Jacob Nelson

comments.text:
Jacob, as a follower of Christ I belive that what sets apart Christianity 
from the other religious views of today is prophecy. You see, as you said 
you have read the bible, the old testament prophecises many things. 
Including Jesus's birth (Isaiah 7:14 and 9:6) and his crucifixion (Psalms 
22: 16-18). The old testament for told a messiah that would heal the blind, 
make the lame walk, cured people with Leprosy, gave the deaf hearing, and 
raised people from the dead! All things that were done in front of

so much I'll just give you a link



How on earth could someone make all this up?

I really hope this helps you and answers your questions 
Oh and never "tough it out"! You never know when your last day is

Any more questions feel free to message me!!

comments.text:
Jacob, we believe in Jesus because of the prophets and the apostles.

The prophets foretold dozens of conditions that the Christ must meet in 
order to be the Christ. These prophecies were written years, sometimes 
hundreds of years, before Jesus walked the earth. Statistically, it would 
be impossible for any one man to fulfill them all - but Jesus did. 

The apostles were the men Jesus appointed to carry on His mission after He 
went to heaven. The apostles gave their lives to fulfilling this mission 
and to training other men to do the same. The government didn't like what 
the apostles were doing - they saw it as a threat to their power. When the 
apostles wouldn't stop they started killing them. In many cases, all the 
apostles had to do was just admit that they hadn't seen Jesus alive after 
He was crucified. If they would do that they could live. NOT ONE DID. They 
all held true, to the point of death, that Jesus had risen. Why would they 
do that unless the believed it? Why would they believe it unless they had 
seen it?

These are two of the main reasons. There are a lot more. A really helpful 
resource is "The Case for Christ" by Lee Stroble. I found this video 
online. Not the best quality, but it gets it done. Take a look! 
http://vimeo.com/17960119

Hope you find what you are looking for! I found it... in Jesus.

+Jacob Nelson  Dude its crazy, the whole concept of God and Christianity is 
pretty much absurd but the crazy thing is that whats makes it even 
stronger. The Bible in itself is the oldest and best selling religious book 
of all time and yet throughout the ages they have tried to destroy it. This 
is what I have found to be true with most religions, the main teaching is 
that you can do it, you can make it you have the power but with 
Christianity it's all about He (God) can do it, with Him nothing is 
impossible. The religion is solely based/dependent on a higher power. Now 
to answer your question on how to really see if this God is real or why 
this one, does he love me, is the creation story true... all I can say is 
there is no possible way I can explain it to you or tell you about it that 
will make you fully fathom it. At least that was the case for me. It is 
when you experience Him that you realize that God is there. So I want to 
give you a challenge (thats if you up for it) just take this month and try 
Him, ask Him to reveal himself to you, pretty much be (don't act like) a 
christian for a month. By the end of the month if He does not show himself 
to you then all your skepticism is true, there is no God/Christian God.
He says it in the bible, "...test me..." Malachi 3:10.

comments.text:
+WatchLearnSee Hey there ;). I'm truly sorry that this is how you perceive 
Christianity, and I'll do my best to respond honestly, and the best in my 
ability. Now, regarding the Inquisition, and the European Christians 
invading early America and Africa (after a few minutes of Google 
searching), I have my doubts that they were even Christians to begin with, 
just misguided people following the orders of a power-hungry person, 
thinking he is doing them a favour by forcefully converting them.. but 
Christianity is not, and never will be that way.. true Christianity is a 
relationship with a God who chose to rescue those who would just reach out 
and believe in the Son that he sent, Jesus Christ.

God made man perfect.. in the beginning, Adam and Eve were perfect in every 
way, without blemish, without sin.. we were created to be in a relationship 
with God until an act of disobedience and selfishness created a gap between 
God and man that man can't possibly cross unless God himself came to 
intervene.. Because of mankind's act of selfishness many years ago, sin 
entered the world. Everything "good" that God created in the world, and 
us.. got twisted in every way possible, and because of this, we separated 
ourselves from God. It's true that God is good.. God is love, God is 
merciful. They're all true.. but God is also just, and justice demands that 
we be punished for our sins, and that punishment is eternally separated 
from him in hell. Is it good for a lawbreaker to get away with his crimes? 
If God just did that, then he's not just, and if he's not just, he's not 
good. Since the beginning, the penalty of sin is death.. meaning someone 
needs to die in order to pay for that sin, a penalty that Jesus himself 
took upon himself so that ANYONE that believes and receives him, doesn't 
have to pay for his own sins, but instead experience eternal life.

So I call myself a Christian not because I'm afraid, but because God in his 
amazing grace brought me out of death, and into life. He has 'saved' me, 
and all the more gladly I'll call him my God for that. But does that mean I 
won't make mistakes? No.. I can, and I will, sometimes horribly... but I 
know that God is faithful even when we are faithless.

Now regarding your two questions, what do you mean by improving one's self? 
Jesus once asked people to follow him, even through dark days, and even 
through bright days, and I will. Sometimes God will make people go through 
dark days so they will realize of how hopeless they are without him, and 
that's not cruel.. it's a loving discipline for his child. Sometimes it is 
better to suffer affliction than to enjoy the bittersweet pleasures of sin, 
and I choose to praise God in stormy days.

So, how do I know that God exists? The evidence is all around us.. how 
horribly barren would the world be.. without bees? Or even better.. what 
about us? The human brain, producing millions of signals every second, and 
the amazing complexity of this world, one thing is removed from it, and it 
all falls apart.

Anyway, I was rambling for a while there, so I hope that this will give you 
a little more insight to what Christianity really is.

In a nutshell, Christianity is a relationship with the creator, who wanted 
to reach out to the people, and save anyone who believes in Him.

Kind regards,
-Arn
comments.author: TheThing2008

comments.text:
+WatchLearnSee
I can see where you're coming from and I'm surprised no one tried to 
explain it to you. It does seem like a contradiction that a benevolent God 
would want you to deny yourself and live only for him. I don't claim to be 
an expert on this but, I know from experience that my life is better when 
I'm close to God. I've found the only way to be close to him is to love him 
and others, or as you put it live for him.

Sure, at first living for yourself sounds good. Everyone likes to be able 
to make their own decisions. Except everyone knows people aren't perfect, 
at least I know I'm not. I also don't know everything. So a lot of times I 
choose to do things that are bad for me. I'm not the only one either, if I 
was there would probably be less addiction, wars, and crime in general. So 
that's why God wants us to live for him and not ourselves. When we live for 
God we are less likely to choose things that are bad for us.

top_comment.text:
the difference between me and all those examples, joseph, moses, gideon and 
the rest is subtle but important. God did something for them in their 
stories when they did what he said. nothing for my mum when she was 
crippled, nothing for my dad when he went blind, nothing for my grandfather 
when he died over months, slowly from cancer or my uncle who died of the 
same, or me when i was crippled and my life ruined.
i did everything that was needed but every time i needed a break i got 
broke instead.
every time anyone i love needed a break they have been broken down instead.
if my son was crippled and i could heal him i would do it. if he offered to 
stay crippled  to save his mother i would praise hime and save them both. 
it's what any good parent would do.

i complement the professional and effective advertisment video, your use of 
the stark messages on screen and empathic performance combined to make an 
excellent product. i can understand why people have rersponded to it well.

this is not just someone having an attack on people of faith or on god or 
whatever, please dont take it as such. just pointing out a fact.

and i get the argument that god sets trials for us and never gives us more 
than we can handle, but at least the second part is not true. he gives so 
many of us more than we can handle. so much it kills them and makes 
everyone they know miserable in the interim spreading more and more 
suffering on the earth that is so loved by the lord. and more, with his 
silence turns people away from him.

i need one sign. just one. some proof that is not words from a bible or 
explained better by some testable theorum. i have read up on my bible, 
listened to the sermons and asked questions on the boards. i have 
investigated the scientific rhetoric of the Athiests (under the lable 
athiests but actually agnostics that reason as though Athiests on the 
grounds that their paradigm is always being updated by new information and 
proofs and so, while they cannot currently state with ABSOLUTE surety that 
there is not god, the chances are so slim that they are confident that 
acting as though there is no god is a reasonable reaction to the evidece). 
as the astute of readers will have probably deduced, i count myself as one 
of this group under that description.

i have not come to the conclusion lightly, and if i am wrong i want to be 
PROVEN incorrect so that i can know the truth and react to what is real, 
rather than what is not real but comfortable.

and just the one last thing before i sign off, a thought that amuses me. i 
actually follow the ten commandments as written fairly well, meaning as 
well and quite often better than when i attended church regularly, even the 
commandments that wouldnt make sence if Hard Athiests are correct.

once again, i complement the video for the excellent performence, direction 
and screenplay. i thank you dear reader for finishing what has been a far 
longer post than i planned. I hold hope that one day everyone  on earth 
finds out exactly what the truth really is on this, most important subject, 
i mean without dieing first.
and mostly i hope that the optimistic faithful are in fact right in their 
belief, that there is a god who truely loves his creations and wants what 
is best for us and that there truly is a great plan that brings justice to 
the needy and forgivness to the sinners of the world.
 
be well.﻿

comments.text:
Hi Norman.. I know it's very hard for you especially that your situation is 
rough. Honestly, I've never been to that deep situation as yours. But I 
suggest you  pray and open your heart to Jesus. Let Him be the ruler of 
your life... Let me share this verse, from James 1:2-4  "Consider it pure 
joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, 3 
because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance. 4 
Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, 
not lacking anything. 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, you should ask God, who 
gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to you. 
6 But when you ask, you must believe and not doubt, because the one who 
doubts is like a wave of the sea, blown and tossed by the wind."

also regarding your question about doing and following the commandments, 
here's a verse:
"Ephesians 2:8-9
8 For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith—and this is not 
from yourselves, it is the gift of God— 9 not by works, so that no one can 
boast."

Take care always and Stay strong... I hope, somehow, I swept some 
confusion..  I'm sorry if you find it to be worthless.. I don't have all 
the answers to your questions.. but I'm hoping that my God, whom i placed 
my life and faith, will help you find those.
comments.author: ElDean Acar

comments.text:
Norman, Maybe its not that God hasnt given you an answer, maybe its cause 
sometimes there's a specific answer we want and we expect God to give us 
that answer cause we think its the right one and its whats best for us.
But if i had to trust either someone who only sees the present or someone 
who sees the past, present and future, I would choose the person who sees 
the past, present and future. Maybe the answer was there long ago but 
you're still looking for a different answer.
Keep an open mind and an open heart.
I dont pretend to know of your suffering cause I dont, But I hope one day 
you will find the answer and I hope it will compensate for all the pain.
Hang in there!! Stay strong!!
I wish you well.
comments.author: anunbrokenheart

comments.text:
I understand your point of view, but personally, I feel like trying to 
follow all the commendments may make a person seem 'perfect', it doesn't 
mean that they are. You need more than following the commendments to please 
God. God does trully love you, and he is pleased with how you follow his 
rules, but God wants you to communicate with him. Prey all the time. I 
learned that as I preyed, it would be easier day by day to understand my 
life and why things fall to certain pieces. At night when you're alone, 
talk to God. He does everything for a purpose. Once, I preyed God to 
protect me from fainting because I'm afraid of becoming unhealthy since I 
get full easilly and cannot eat alot. The next morning I fainted and threw 
up with an empty stomach and the emergency had to bring me to the hospital. 
I was angry at God that morning because I thought that he purposely was 
punishing me, but at the end I realized that if I didn't end up going to 
the hospital, I wouldn't have been subrcibed to get Iron pills or multiple 
vitomin pills. If I wasn't taking these pills by now, I would still feel 
very tired and look unhealthy and these pills are helping my body and 
helping me become stronger. What I am trying to say is that you need to 
talk to God All the time and observe the world. You need to silence the 
world and listen to him. Pay close attention to God because he loves to 
communicate with everyone because he loves us all. And once you do that, 
you'll understand why things are a certain way in your life. My grandma 
also passed away because of cancer. She was so sick that the doctors had to 
give her drugs so she could pass away more easilly. I know how it feels to 
lose people you love out of death. That's what I feared the most. But I 
soon came to terms that perhaps it's because God has bigger plans for them. 
Perhaps it's their time to see something bigger and more beautiful than the 
place we live in. Talk to God every night and prey. You'll seek the answers 
you're looking for :)
comments.author: gohar harutyunyan

comments.text:
+WatchLearnSee  Bless has several contexts, but for me, it means to be 
fruitful, gifted or gifts from God, like when I asks for a phone, and few 
days later I got it, that's a blessing!  Or a natural talent, that's a 
blessing from God, my family is also a blessing from God, Christ is a gift, 
he's the best blessings of God to be given, :D. And also,  I was actually a 
Buddhist along with my family except my mom, and she converted us, we're 
not in the most best situation right now but I'm grateful to at least be 
given the knowledge to know Him. Of course no one would be converted in the 
most logical way, because most of the times, it's trough the most illogical 
way that we can get to God.
comments.author: Johnson Fung

comments.text:
My guess that those 46 people don't want to be blessed, and despite what 
you may believe, they neither care nor do they need your blessing.

I know I'm sounding cold but I'm serious. Really guys. I'm an agnostic, I'm 
friends with people from all religions, and atheists, and Christians are 
still the most "We are right and you shall be converted" religion in Earth.
The harsh truth is that nobody outside your cult for logical reasons will 
ever be converted (unless they get paid and loved for doing so, like 
several former atheists who turned into very famous Christian writers and 
priests overnight).

Every time you say "May God bless you because you are lost" (or something 
along those lines) you make your religion suffer because that's one of the 
most shallow and annoying things you can say.
comments.author: WatchLearnSee

top_comment.text:
Do you know why He brings these walls into your life? Simply this: He wants 
you to turn around and come back to Him; He wants you to become Stronger; 
He wants you to become wise, and knowledgeable, and especially, He wants 
you to BE A LIGHT FOR HIM, showing the World all His wonders, and how 
powerful He truly is, and how with Him, ALL things are possible. Don't let 
(the worldly) reality fool you, you create your reality. Nothing is too 
hard for God, nothing at all. So, never lose Faith in Him. You may think he 
blocked you from what blessings are to come next, by building a wall, but, 
He built that wall for you to tear down, & to say to the world "There is a 
God, who is Mighty, & awesome, and Powerful, and can do ANYTHING! If you 
believe in Him". :)﻿
top_comment.author: Madison Mallard

captions.text:
The wall at Jericho was an impenetrable force
to any army that was trying to overtake the

city. Before even dealing with the wall, the
attacking troops would have to navigate their

way across a 27 foot wide, 9 foot deep pit
that lined the outer edges of the city. Then,

there was the wall itself, a 17 foot high,
5 foot thick pure mass of solid stone. If

the attacking army managed to get this far
without being shot down by archers, all that

was left was to defeat the well-trained Canaanite
army that was waiting within.

This was the reality for a young leader named
Joshua and his ragtag Israelite army. These

Israelites, who had seen an entire generation
live and die while wandering through the desert,

were tired, hungry, and facing what seemed
like an impossible task, a hopeless situation.

Now, I haven't lived very long, but I've lived
long enough to know this: that running into

walls is a part of life, and the bigger the
wall, the more hopeless the situation can

seem. The large walls of sickness, loss, divorce,
addiction, they pop up all around us, and

they seem impenetrable. And just like the
wall at Jericho, these walls rarely stand

alone. The walls of our lives are often accompanied
by a deep pit of pain, suffering, and despair,

and all the while, an army of hopelessness
attacks us on every side. The question is

asked all the time, if God loves us so much
and is so powerful, then how could He allow

these walls to pop up around me? Now, I don't
pretend to have the answer to any of those

questions, nor do I pretend to understand
just how deep or dark your suffering has been.

I simply want to suggest that maybe God does
His best work from seemingly hopeless situations.

When I read the Bible, I read about people
and characters, all who faced seemingly hopeless

situations. In fact, I cannot find a single
person who walked faithfully with God without

first facing a hopeless situation.
Adam and Eve ruined Paradise by inviting sin

and death into a perfect world - a hopeless
case.

Joseph was betrayed by his brothers for his
pride and put in prison - a hopeless case.

Moses was cornered on the banks of the Red
Sea with the most powerful army in the world

breathing down his neck - a hopeless case.
Gideon was three hundred against three hundred

thousand.
David stood across the valley from a blood-thirsty

giant.
Esther was a woman trying to gain a word with

a prideful king.
Daniel's roommate was a lion.

His friends were thrown in an oven.
Jonah sucked at his job and got stuck in a

whale.
Peter was a coward.

Paul was imprisoned.
The five thousand had no food.

Lazarus was dead.
Timothy was too young.

Abraham was too old.
The youngest son was too stupid.

The walls of Jericho were too strong.
And Jesus was humiliated, hung on a cross,

and buried in a tomb, burying all hopes of
the revolution that was hoped for for thousands

of years.
Now everybody was ready to close the book

on these stories, the end, game over. But
if there's one thing we learn from the Scriptures,

it's that we can never place a period where
God has placed a comma, because when all other

options have been worn out, when circumstances
couldn't get worse, when everything else has

failed, get ready, because that is exactly
where God shows up.

Because Joseph became second in command.
The Red Sea parted.

Gideon won without lifting a weapon.
Goliath's head was on a plate.

Esther spoke and the king listened.
Daniel tamed the lion.

The oven felt like room temperature.
Nineveh repented.

Peter became the rock.
Paul rejoiced.

Twelve basket-fulls were left over.
Lazarus was just kidding.

Timothy built a church.
Abraham built a family.

The youngest son came home to a party.
The walls of Jericho came a-tumblin' down!

And Jesus Christ pulled off the resurrection,
defeating sin and death and the creation that

had been marred so many years ago was now
restored for all time!

With God, what seems like a hopeless situation
is not only possible, it's favorable, because

only God can turn a mess into a message. Only
God can turn a trial into a triumph, a test

into a testimony, and a victim into a victory.
His power is made perfect in weakness, so

let us rejoice in our trials and hold unswervingly
to the hope we profess, because He who promised

is faithful, was faithful, and will always
be faithful, no matter how hopeless the situation.
